html.p: The 0install.net site is held in a Git repository. If you want to work on it, you can clone it like this:
Run 'make' to generate the .html files from the .xml ones. The XML syntax is basically HTML, but an XSLT stylesheet generates the navigation.

ul.li: Copy one of the existing .xml files to create the new page.
Add it to the Makefile so it gets built.
Add it to structure.xml to put it in the navigation.
Add it to Git with "git add page.xml".
If you don't have admin access, send a patch / pull request to the mailing list.

If you have shell and Git access, push your changes to the repository and then run /home/project-web/zero-install/update-from-git from the shell server. I use this command: ssh -o PasswordAuthentication=false \ username,zero-install@shell.sourceforge.net \ /home/project-web/zero-install/update-from-git
